subject: p19182863
History: Evaluation of the patient with left-sided pleural effusion, assessment.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. The heart size and mediastinum are stable. Right pleural effusion has increased in the interim, moderate. Replaced what appear to be tricuspid and aortic valves are redemonstrated. There is no evidence of pneumothorax. The left internal jugular line most likely continues into the left SVC given its position. Fracture of the second rib on the left is noted, seen on the multiple previous studies.
